title: Book in K1
content:
The book in Keen1 says "Kant".

I was thinking, the only possible thing with Kant attatched to it is the philosopher Immanuel Kant. I'm not even sure this is what it is, but it would be an interesting allusion if it were.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
That is possible but what similarities do Keen and Kant have?-----------------

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
I'm pretty sure it's a reference to Kant. It's cool, although personally I don't like his philosophy.. The question is, why would the aliens take toys and candy and then something pretty heavy reading such as anything written by Kant? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] No idea..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
KeenRush --I think everyone knows that Christians detest Transcendentalists. No need to emphasize that. =P


I never said there was a connection outside naming. *shrugs* Maybe Hall or Remaro are TDMers.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
Well; its quite obvious that although the cheerful and utterly sophmoric Yorps would be content to muddle about with soft toys; their worshipping of a bouncy metal stick has raised somewhat...interesting questions in both the minds of Yorp and Garg; questions liek 'Why does the holy pogo allow suffering?' and 'Why doesn't the holy pogo have two eyes, even though it lets the gargs be in charge?'

After several years of vigourus religious debate, The Lord of the Glowing Box, cheif priest, of the holy boot [A cult directly opposed to the 'evil pogo stick of doom'] announced that he would journey to earth, origion of the holy pogo and bring forth a book of great wisdom to lead the martian hordes. He brought back Kant, which immediately caused a 120 year long religious war and caused the arising of a new sect based apon the works of Kahn.

Hence the martian saying 'Immanuel Kany, but Kublai Kahn.'

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]That is possible but what similarities do Keen and Kant have?[hr][/quote]

Kant is smart, Keen is smart, there you go. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
It makes sense for Keen to have something "hard" to read, even if it doesn't make sense for the books to be on Mars.
It's just like how Duke collects Duke paraphernalia, or rather... well, whatever the word is that won't pop up in my head... in the strangest places.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
The book on mars is just like candy in Keen Dreams. No one knows why its there, or how it got there. It just is.-Genius314

title: Re: Book in K1
content:
Hehe, that's good one Retodon8; yeah, in Duke II he (Duke) collects Duke t-shirts, games and stuff..
Yeah, it's definitely to show that Keen is able read just about everything that comes to his path (literally). Kant doesn't need to have anything in common with Keen.

But yeah, as Genius314 said, why would there be candy in the land of vegetables? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content: I figure they picked "Kant" because it was the shortest philosopher's name they could fit on the side of a 12 pixel book.  :-P

title: Wackiness!
content:
Heh, this reminds me of a conversation I had with KeenRush just an hour or two back. He was thinking too hard about a mod, wondering why there were all these things conveniently lying around to allow the level to progress, even though the area is supposedly unexplored.

There's one simple answer to such a question: It's Commander Keen. Some things need explaining, but the real art is in deciding what doesn't. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Wackiness!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Whiles we're at it, tell me why water condeses in the air in Keen 4, and is about half of keen's hight, and also; what happens when he touches it? Does he eat it?[hr][/quote]

Judging by the splash they make, they burst, however it is possible Keen collects them. Also, the droplets are magnified by the Digital-screen-air interface, in reality they're only raindrop sized.

[quote]Quote:[hr]There's one simple answer to such a question: It's Commander Keen. Some things need explaining, but the real art is in deciding what doesn't.[hr][/quote]

Its quite simple actually, *someone* had to construct the level, and to do that they had to get from one side to the other, via the placement of needed things, same goes for most Keen levels, except mine, which actually *are* impossible.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
